channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Over flowing recycling bins, 19th August
item.description:
Overflowing recycling bins. Garbage bags leaking from business, Damsals Collective. This is right beside a residential entrance.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Union Walk, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant fly- tipping in residential car park of Hawkins court, 19th August
item.description:
Please help us to cleared massive pile of domestic rubbish which has been damp in our car park.We have elderly,small children and people with special needs living here and it's create massive danger.Du to constant fly- tipping we are now suffering from infestation of rats and mouses. Please help. Residential car park located behind Hawkins court, which is in the corner Woodhill road and 31 Prospect Vale.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prospect Vale, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uncollected Rubbish in small walk through to Bromfield Court from St James's Road Opposite the Gregorian Arms., 19th August
item.description:
There is a large amount of rubbish at the opening of Bromfield Court opposite The Gregorian Arms. This rubbish has been there for a few weeks this will encourage other fly tippers to put more rubbish there. Grateful if Southwark Council could arrange for the rubbish to be removed before it starts to get out of hand and the people who reside there will not be able to get through. This makes the area look so unsightly and uncared for which is not the case. Not sure who is responsible for this mess.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Jamaica Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog mess, 19th August
item.description:
In st Keverne road outside number 2 king and Queen close
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): King and Queen Close, Elmstead, London

item.title: Sandy hill road- across Woolwich central Baptist church, 19th August
item.description:
Many weeks and cleaners aren’t sweeping sandy hill road. Lots of rubbish on the road and pavement across to Woolwich Central Baptist Church. Please kindly send cleaners asap. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Sandy Hill Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bottles, Cans and general rubbish, 19th August
item.description:
Many bottles and cans have been left in the rose garden opposite numbers 5 and 7 Groombridge Rd. I reported it over a week ago, but nothing has been done yet.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Church Crescent, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping clothing and childrens’ items, 19th August
item.description:
Black bin liners of clothing and child or baby paraphernalia has been fly tipped on frogley road outside house numbers 1 and 2. The rubbish doesn’t come from us (at no.2) or our neighbours (no.1) and seems to be a flytipping issue. The bags are attracting flies, please can this be cleaned up ASAP?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Frogley Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): School Road, Chislehurst, London

item.title: Rubbish left on the street, 19th August
item.description:
20 minutes ago, Westminster rubbish collection came they picked up a few bags and they left all that mess that’s not acceptable. They should be ashamed. Not not doing what they are paid to do pick up rubbish

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Westbourne Gardens, Bayswater, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping o/s 16 - 17 Haldane Road, 19th August
item.description:
There are about 7 black sacks that have been dumped on the pavement and have now ripped apart. The rubbish is strewn over the pavement. Please can this be cleared asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haldane Road, London

item.title: Sinking metal cover near speed hump (outside Cherry Court in ST Johns Road, 19th August
item.description:
A large metal cover appears to have sunk into the roadway with crack lines around it. It is next to a Thames Water metal cover. It is just by the speed hump. It now makes a large noise when driven over.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Johns Road, Albany Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pepe's commercial waste not correctly disposed, 19th August
item.description:
Can you please investigate this chicken shop and do surprise visits to catch them and apply penalties or even close the shop. They have daily left commercial waste on pavement and do not follow commercial rules to dispose waste. There have ben more than 50 reports raised to the council related to this same location and they continue to leave trash on the pavement. There are rats and wheelchair users can no longer use the pavement. They need to spot this and be penalised.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Woolwich Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet
